content.description: A straight forward climb in terms of beta.
content.location: Stand-start below the horizontal crack. Climb the face up to an obvious jug on small crimps. From the jug, move to the lip and top-out. The vertical crack to the left is off. Variation A - V2: Use the vertical crack.

content.description: One of the best climbs in Gleanmeal. A must do if you come here.
content.location: Sit-start on the large flake and move right following obvious holds. Break the lip, and climb up the slab to the top. Note: The beginning moves will stay dry in moderate rain. Variation A - V5: Start as “R.I.P.G.B”. Once over the lip, climb to the horizontal crack from the left jug on the slab. Finish the same as “All Systems Go”.
Stand-start on the two/three finger edge and the left-facing diagonal corner. Climb up the face through the various pinches and crimps.

content.description: Decent climb that is a fun V2. Tread lightly on this route.
content.location: Awkward start. Sit-start on the right-rising sloping rail and move up and slightly left through small crimps until you gain the positive edge eight feet up. Finish over the mossy bulge. Variation A - V2: Start on the positive ledge at head height and traverse left into “American Ninja Warrior”.

content.description: Difficult climb that starts in the cave!
content.location: Same start as “R.I.P.G.B.”. Bust left at the three pocket below the lip and climb to the shallow horizontal crack.

content.description: This is the first wall you see when approaching from the West Side parking area. The wall is host to an impressive overhanging feature as well as technical face climbs. Go to the guidebook to get more comprehensive info on the climbing at this link. There are detailed topo's in it, so use that instead of MP
